original: Bengtsson, Bengt Folke, överste, Karlsborg, f. 30/9/97 i Tosjö, Krist. 1., av godsförv. Sven B. o. Ella Ljunggren. G. 32 m. Karin Fresk. Barn: Göran f. 33. — Stud:ex. i Kristianstad 16, AIHS 20-21, GCI 21-22. Fänr. v. Wendes art:reg. 18, löjtn. v. art:-stab. 30, kapten 32, v. Smål. art:reg. 36, major 39, v. luftv. 39, v. gen:stabs-kåren 40, öv:löjtn. 41, v. gen :istabskå-ren 41, v. försvarsstaben 42, chef f. Gbgs luftvärnskår 43-46, överste 44, chef f. Karlsborgs luftvärnsreg. sed. 46. Repet. v. AIHS 24-26, flygspan:-utb. 31, :avd:ch. v. försvarsstabens luftförsv :avd. 40-43, kommend. t» Finl. 32, delt. i finska vinterkr. 40, stud:-resa t. Tyskl., HolL, Belg., Frankr. 41, Finl. 42. Led. i 41 års hemorts-försv :sakk :komm., sakk. i luftskydds-insp. o. utrymn:komm. 40-43, omb. i riksluftskyddsförb. 40-43. Skr.: Vad var o. en måste veta om bombanfall (41), Bombanf. o. bombverkan (43). RSO, RVO, LKrVA, FBskftjMlkl, RLSFtgG, KTyskÖO, FFrK3kl m. sv, FMM, Skidl:m i g, PistSkytteGM, 0’lGM gymn. Antwerpen 20.
translated:
Bengt Folke Bengtsson was a colonel from Karlsborg, born on September 30, 1897 in Tosjö, Kristianstad county. He was the son of estate manager Sven B. and Ella Ljunggren. He married Karin Fresk in 1932 and they had one child, Göran, born in 1933. Bengt Folke completed his studies with a high school diploma from Kristianstad in 1916, followed by military academies AIHS from 1920-1921 and GCI from 1921-1922. He served as a second lieutenant in the Wendes artillery regiment in 1918, then as a lieutenant in artillery staff in 1930, and as a captain in the Småland artillery regiment in 1932. He served as a major in 1939 in the Air Force and in 1940 as a lieutenant colonel in the general staff corps, reaching the rank of colonel in 1944. He was the commander of Gothenburg's anti-aircraft regiment from 1943-1946 and thereafter the commander of Karlsborg's anti-aircraft regiment. 

He repeated his military education at AIHS from 1924-1926 and attended flight training in 1931. He was a department chief in the air defense department of the defense staff from 1940-1943 and served as a commander in Finland in 1932 during the Winter War. He went on study trips to Germany, Holland, Belgium, and France in 1941 and to Finland in 1942. He was a member of the local defense committee for 41 years and a consultant in air protection inspection and evacuation committees from 1940-1943. He was also a delegate to the National Air Protection Association from 1940-1943. Bengt Folke wrote two books, "What one must know about bombing" in 1941 and "Bomb attacks and the effect of bombs" in 1943. He received several awards for his service, including RSO, RVO, LKrVA, FBskftjMlkl, RLSFtgG, KTyskÖO, FFrK3kl m. sv, FMM, Skidl:m i g, PistSkytteGM, and 0'lGM gymn. He participated in sports and was a gymnastics champion in Antwerp in 1920.

book.name: What one must know about bombing
Bomb attacks and the effect of bombs
